name: Hotel Regina

reviews.text: This hotel is great. They are currently refurbishing (please note that this does not mean that you are disturbed by noise) and I stayed in one of the brand new rooms which are furnished very nicely with plenty of storage and a fridge, safe, aircon and tv with excellent choice of channels (not that you will probably fin time to watch them!!). The showers are also great and perfect for eliminating the days sand etc! Everything spotlessly clean in rooms, reception, corridors etc and the staff are very friendly and helpful. There is a small 'business centre' with PCs with very reasonable internet prices and more importantly, aircon!
reviews.title: Great Hotel - give it a try!

reviews.text: Basically this hotel is worth way more than it's star rating and is great value and in a great location near the metro system. Flamengo has plenty of restaurants and amenities and the main stretches of Copacabana are only 10 mins by taxi (which are very cheap). Would def recommend this one!
reviews.title: Great service, price and location!

likes.disliked: — the breakfast is only untyl 11 am...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect location, right at Seville metro station - walking distance to everything. Friendly staff - helpful and smiling - especially the porters and serving staff. Good buffet breakfast. Rooms recently renovated - large and stylish, we had one at the front looking out on the main street but windows and shutter blinds kept most of the noise out. You really can't beat this hotel if you want somewhere central and affordable in Madrid.
reviews.title: Central, Friendly, Affordable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is just in front of the tube station Sevilla so you can take the subway directly from Barajas, the airport, for about 1,60 euros!
reviews.title: Very comfortable rooms, excellent location.

reviews.text: The hotel staff at the reception desk are friendly and very helpful. They recommended us a great restaurant near the hotel, and helped and advised us when we were told our flight had been delayed: they offered us a late check out for a very low price.
reviews.title: Wonderful location, great room...felt very safe!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds are king sized and the linen, super soft. Don´t use the hotel shampoo, though, it smells really bad.
reviews.title: Great hotel fab location

reviews.text: The location is perfect, just a 2minute walk from Plaza Mayor.
reviews.title: Excellent location, great value booked through Tripadvisor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Regina Madrid
reviews.title: Nice Central Hotel

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in late September,133 Euros pn B&B.Rather expensive but that is the way of it in Spain. It fitted our criteria of A/C,fridge,non smoking and a safe in the room. It was also close to Trapsatur’s bus station where we ended a tour.
reviews.title: great locations

reviews.text: Reception was quite large with plenty of armchairs and a nice looking bar.Check in was easy; staff spoke English and was friendly. We had been given adjoining rooms with our friends which was nice but not really an issue as they were leaving next day, but we appreciated it.
reviews.title: Amazing value

reviews.text: For a tourist the loction of this hotel is about the best Madrid can offer. The hotel has been recently modernised, rooms are clean and staff efficient. The size and quality of the rooms does however vary a lot. On one of our visits we were given a small room, suffering from a strange heating problem: there was no way the very high temperature to which the room was heated up could be brought down. We were moved then to a great, large (and cool) room in the fourth floor. All in all, however, for the price a good hotel in an unbeatable location.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location

reviews.text: The first thing you notice is how close this hotel is to the Metro. Literally, thirty feet from the "Sevilla" stop on the Metro, a very central stop, minutes from Puerta del sol and plaza santa ana. The hotel is impeccably clean, and has a very decent breakfast buffet. right next door there's a nice cafe, and around Plaza santa ana there are tons of good restaurants and bars. The double decker tourist bus also has a stop right near the hotel, if you choose to take it.
reviews.title: Great little hotel in a central location
Fab time at the Regina
reviews.text: Have just spent three wonderful days at the Regina Hotel in Madrid. The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable , the location was excellent, a short stroll from Puerto Del Sol with plenty of bars and restaurants, the bar at the hotel was great and Antonio the barman was very friendly and smiley. One word of warning don't bother with Casa Patas flamenco and tapas bar , very unfriendly ,bad service and a rip off , they tried to charge us 8 euros for bread!

We had booked a room via the internet but when we got there they had no record of our booking (good job I had a confirmation email!). They found us a room in the basement of the hotel which didn't even deserve a star rating. The door was kicked in and we didn't even have a window. I immediately went and complained and then then put us in a room which had obviously just been refurbished.
reviews.title: Hotel not great but in good location
Plush hotel in very good location
reviews.text: The room was what you would expect for a 3* - clean and fairly spacious. The minibar was locked up and we were told it was out of use which was annoying as we wanted to use it to keep water cold in the heat. The security safe in the room was also not working.

reviews.title: Our kids loved this Hotel
reviews.text: Breakfast was not great - a typical continental style buffet but the food and drink tasted artificial and wasn't very fresh.
All this said, the location was good and we walked to most of the sightseeing attrations with ease.
reviews.title: Bad rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is in centre of Madrid next to Sevilla Metro 2 mins walk to Sol and 5 mins walk from Airport bus stop at Cibeles.
reviews.title: Decent hotel
Great hotel and location
reviews.text: Entrance and public area of good standard with restaurant, cafe and sitting area for guests.
Check in was polite and efficient.
reviews.title: Superbly located hotel with excellent, helpful staff and pleasant rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms, first room offered was dark with no natural light, there was a window but it appeared to face into a internal shaft, couldnt stay for 5 days in this, returned to reception.Second room had two single beds seperated by furniture, not suitable for married couple.Third room was described as an upgrade but appeared smaller, but had better light and a small terrace allbeight surrounded by a 6' wall and yellow fence arrangement.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was of a very good standard, well maintained and clean, the bathroom was also very good with toiletries supplied. There was a flat screen TV with a reasonable number of chanels but I would have preferred BBC included. Mini bar in room but did not use cheaper to get drinks from local supermarket.
reviews.title: Great experience and excellent location for tourist

reviews.text: We had a large room, clean and well serviced, an OK buffet breakfast if you don't fancy finding your own, but it was perfectly placed for walking to the Reina Sofia and El Prado and right opposite the Metro en route from the airport. It was noisy at night and we had a room at the back which had revellers and bin-men competing at one stage in the early hours - but so do many cities! Also it was very well located to explore most central parts of a great city. The staff indulged our use of English and were most helpful. We would stay here again.
reviews.title: Good value, excellent location

reviews.text: Located quite near Puerta del sol and another metro station, this hotel is a great springboard for a tour of Madrid.
reviews.title: Good location, nice staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Modern, but oddly laid out rooms, very helpful staff distinguish this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If anything, it is a little corporate for a traveller wanting to relax, and the walls are a bit thin. For some reason our air con did not work on the last night of our stay.
reviews.title: lovely hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A fairly option. Not bad, not exceptionally good.
reviews.title: If only we were younger and thinner...

reviews.text: It is not only the location that is the best you can get if you want to spend some days sightseeing in Madrid. For me, most of all, what makes this hotel great is the staff: efficient, knowledgable and proffessional, a really great team, that runs this busy place really well! Well done guys!
reviews.title: Faultless

reviews.text: Spent 3 nights in early Sept at Hotel Regina, reserved at a great rate. Central location for most sights, and the Sevilla metro station is right outside the front door if you want to go further afield. Courteous and helpful staff, from the reception desk through to the maids. Room was modern, functional and spotlessly clean, and we were given a bottle of Cava and some fresh fruit on the first evening. Great breakfasts, and the adjoining cafeteria attracts a lot of local and business custom - always a good sign. Numerous, bars, cafes and eateries within walking distance. Would certainly stay there again if returning to Madrid.
reviews.title: Good hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Regina is superbly located in the centre of Madrid, from which most sights can be reached within a few minutes walk. We arrived after a late flight at the hotel and were allocated a modern well appointed bedroom but without a view. The hotel was full and of course we were disappointed particularly so as this was our anniversary. The following morning the front desk manager who was both courteous and charming assured us that he would find us an alternative. To our pleasant surprise when we returned from a tour of the City, we were shown to a very large airy elegant bedroom at the front of the hotel. We couldn't fault the breakfast nor any of the staff.
reviews.title: A 3 star gem that should have a 4 star rating

reviews.text: A nice anniversary touch - a bottle of champagne and a fruit plate awaited us in our bedroom adding to our perfect stay in this lovely City. We will definitely be returning to this hotel and would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Excellent value and location

reviews.text: The hotel is perfectly situated to explore Madrid - with a Metro station right outside the hotel entrance. I recommend purchasing the Madrid Tourist Travel Pass at the airport for the duration of your stay as it is extremely good value for money. I did not eat at the hotel, though the restaurant and room service menu looks delicious and extensive. There are plenty of cafes just outside the hotel where you can buy a cheap, and local, breakfast. I booked this hotel with an excellent rate and the twin room was perfect for my friend and me for a four night stay. Spotlessly clean, great room service, a very useful locking safe (which you can lock with a metallic strip card - no charge), extra pillows and blankets and great air conditioning. I also left some jewellery in the room when I checked out and returned about 45mins later - was given a card to get into the room with absolutely no problems. Very helpful staff.
reviews.title: Value for money
